thread.title: Heroic doting dad killed in crash outside primary school pushed nine-year-old daughter to safety
thread.title_full: Heroic doting dad killed in crash outside primary school pushed nine-year-old daughter to safety

author: Lucy Clarke-Billings
title: Heroic doting dad killed in crash outside primary school pushed nine-year-old daughter to safety

organizations.name: st thomas more catholic primary school

text:
Mr John was described as a religious man who was very friendly and family-orientated (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A doting dad fatally hit by a car pushed his nine-year-old daughter out of the way to save her life. 
Paul John, from Wythenshawe, in Manchester, died in hospital on Thursday, two days after being struck by a Kia Picanto outside St Thomas More Catholic Primary School. 
His little girl, Angela, suffered only minor cuts and bruises. 
Witnesses reported seeing the 47-year-old desperately push his daughter out of the way of the oncoming vehicle. 
Moments later the car struck a 27-year-old woman and her two-year-old son, who was in a pushchair. 
The woman was treated for a broken wrist and the toddler was uninjured, the Manchester Evening News reports. Read More Pedestrian falls down huge hole after pavement collapses beneath his feet Tragic Paul John was hit by a car in Wythenshawe (Photo: Facebook) 
The 88-year-old driver of the Kia remained at the scene and is helping detectives with their investigation, police confirmed. 
Tributes are being paid to devout Catholic Mr John. 
The 47-year-old attended St Elizabeth’s RC Church in Wythenshawe, and donated all of his organs to give the gift of life to others, the leader of his church group said. 
The dad-of-two moved to Manchester from Kerala in southern India in 2001, and worked for Sky Chefs at Manchester Airport. 
Sajan Chacko, president of the Manchester Knanaya Catholic Association, said: “Paul was very involved in church activities, and was a very active member – we are like a family at the church. 
“He was a lovely man, he always had a nice smile on his face. 
“He was never rude, and was always very friendly. He was very religious. He spent most of his time with the family, looking after the kids. 
“That was his life. He would go to work, then go back and look after his family.” Read More Driver jailed for playing 'Russian Roulette' with friends' lives after they died in horror police chase smash Paul John died in hospital two days later (Photo: Manchester Evening) 
Mr John’s wife, Mini Paul, works as a staff nurse at Wythenshawe Hospital and his 13-year-old daughter Kimberley attends Whalley Range High School. 
A special church service will be held tonight at St Elizabeth’s R C Church on Lomond Road at 6.30pm tonight (Friday), in his memory. 
Pc Ed Lister of GMP's Serious Collision Investigation Unit said: “My thoughts are with the man and his family. I can’t begin to imagine what they are going through. Our specialist officers are helping them through this incredibly difficult time. 
"Our investigation is still ongoing and we are still appealing for witnesses. We would like to hear from anyone who witnessed the incident or who may have dash-cam footage showing the collision.” Like us on Facebook
